# ZipVoice‚ö° ## Fast and High-Quality Zero-Shot Text-to-Speech with Flow Matching
## Overview

# ZipVoice‚ö° ## Szybka i wysokiej jako≈õci synteza mowy z tekstu bez uczenia g≈Çosu z dopasowaniem przep≈Çywu
## PrzeglƒÖd

RowTranslations.originContent: ## Fast and High-Quality Zero-Shot Text-to-Speech with Flow Matching
RowTranslations.translatedContent: ## Szybka i wysokiej jako≈õci synteza mowy z tekstu bez uczenia g≈Çosu z dopasowaniem przep≈Çywu

Content:
ZipVoice is a series of fast and high-quality zero-shot TTS models based on flow matching. ### 1. Key features - Small and fast: only 123M parameters. - High-quality voice cloning: state-of-the-art performance in speaker similarity, intelligibility, and naturalness. - Multi-lingual: support Chinese and English. - Multi-mode: support both single-speaker and dialogue speech generation. ### 2. Model variants
Model Name Description Paper Demo
ZipVoice The basic model supporting zero-shot single-speaker TTS in both Chinese and English.
ZipVoice-Distill The distilled version of ZipVoice, featuring improved speed with minimal performance degradation.
ZipVoice-Dialog A dialogue generation model built on ZipVoice, capable of generating single-channel two-party spoken dialogues.
Translation:
ZipVoice to seria szybkich i wysokiej jako≈õci modeli TTS typu zero-shot opartych na flow matching. ### 1. Kluczowe cechy - Ma≈Çy i szybki: tylko 123M parametr√≥w. - Wysokiej jako≈õci klonowanie g≈Çosu: najnowocze≈õniejsza wydajno≈õƒá w zakresie podobie≈Ñstwa m√≥wcy, zrozumia≈Ço≈õci i naturalno≈õci. - Wielojƒôzyczny: obs≈Çuguje jƒôzyk chi≈Ñski i angielski. - Wielomodowy: obs≈Çuguje generowanie mowy pojedynczego m√≥wcy oraz dialog√≥w. ### 2. Warianty modeli
Nazwa modelu Opis Publikacja Demo
ZipVoice Podstawowy model obs≈ÇugujƒÖcy zero-shot TTS dla pojedynczego m√≥wcy w jƒôzyku chi≈Ñskim i angielskim.
ZipVoice-Distill Wersja destylowana ZipVoice, charakteryzujƒÖca siƒô zwiƒôkszonƒÖ szybko≈õciƒÖ przy minimalnej utracie wydajno≈õci.
ZipVoice-Dialog Model generowania dialog√≥w oparty na ZipVoice, zdolny do generowania jednopasmowych, dwustronnych dialog√≥w m√≥wionych.

Content: ZipVoice-Dialog-Stereo The stereo variant of ZipVoice-Dialog, enabling two-channel dialogue generation with each speaker assigned to a distinct channel. ## News **2025/07/14**: **ZipVoice-Dialog** and **ZipVoice-Dialog-Stereo**, two spoken dialogue generation models, are released. [![arXiv](https://img.shields.io/badge/arXiv-Paper-COLOR.svg)](https://arxiv.org/abs/2507.09318) [![demo page](https://img.shields.io/badge/GitHub.io-Demo_Page-blue?logo=Github&style=flat-square)](https://zipvoice-dialog.github.io) **2025/07/14**: **OpenDialog** dataset, a 6.8k-hour spoken dialogue dataset, is released. Download at [![hf](https://img.shields.io/badge/%F0%9F%A4%97%20HuggingFace-Dataset-yellow)](https://huggingface.co/datasets/k2-fsa/OpenDialog), [![ms](https://img.shields.io/badge/ModelScope-Dataset-blue?logo=data)](https://www.modelscope.cn/datasets/k2-fsa/OpenDialog). Check details at [![arXiv](https://img.shields.io/badge/arXiv-Paper-COLOR.svg)](https://arxiv.org/abs/2507.09318). **2025/06/16**: **ZipVoice** and **ZipVoice-Distill** are released. Clone the ZipVoice repository

Content: ### 2. (Optional) Create a Python virtual environment


Content:
### 4. Install k2 for training or efficient inference

**k2 is necessary for training** and can speed up inference. Nevertheless, you can still use the inference mode of ZipVoice without installing k2.

> **Note:**  Make sure to install the k2 version that matches your PyTorch and CUDA version. For example, if you are using pytorch 2.5.1 and CUDA 12.1, you can install k2 as follows:
Translation:
### 4. Zainstaluj k2 do treningu lub wydajnego wnioskowania

**k2 jest niezbƒôdne do treningu** i mo≈ºe przyspieszyƒá wnioskowanie. Niemniej jednak, mo≈ºesz korzystaƒá z trybu wnioskowania ZipVoice bez instalowania k2.

> **Uwaga:** Upewnij siƒô, ≈ºe instalujesz wersjƒô k2 pasujƒÖcƒÖ do Twojej wersji PyTorch i CUDA. Na przyk≈Çad, je≈õli u≈ºywasz pytorch 2.5.1 i CUDA 12.1, mo≈ºesz zainstalowaƒá k2 w nastƒôpujƒÖcy spos√≥b:

Content:
```bash
pip install k2==1.24.4.dev20250208+cuda12.1.torch2.5.1 -f https://k2-fsa.github.io/k2/cuda.html
```
Translation:
```bash
pip install k2==1.24.4.dev20250208+cuda12.1.torch2.5.1 -f https://k2-fsa.github.io/k2/cuda.html
```

U≈ºytkownicy z Chin kontynentalnych mogƒÖ zapoznaƒá siƒô ze stronƒÖ https://k2-fsa.org/zh-CN/get-started/k2/.


Content:
## Usage

### 1. Single-speaker speech generation

To generate single-speaker speech with our pre-trained ZipVoice or ZipVoice-Distill models, use the following commands (Required models will be downloaded from HuggingFace):

#### 1.1 Inference of a single sentence
Translation:
## U≈ºytkowanie

### 1. Generowanie mowy jednego m√≥wcy

Aby wygenerowaƒá mowƒô jednego m√≥wcy przy u≈ºyciu naszych wytrenowanych modeli ZipVoice lub ZipVoice-Distill, u≈ºyj nastƒôpujƒÖcych polece≈Ñ (wymagane modele zostanƒÖ pobrane z HuggingFace):

#### 1.1 Wnioskowanie dla pojedynczego zdania

Content:
```bash
python3 -m zipvoice.bin.infer_zipvoice \
    --model-name zipvoice \
    --prompt-wav prompt.wav \
    --prompt-text "I am the transcription of the prompt wav." \
    --text "I am the text to be synthesized." \
    --res-wav-path result.wav
```
Translation:
```bash
python3 -m zipvoice.bin.infer_zipvoice \
    --model-name zipvoice \
    --prompt-wav prompt.wav \
    --prompt-text "I am the transcription of the prompt wav." \
    --text "I am the text to be synthesized." \
    --res-wav-path result.wav
```

Content:
- `--model-name` can be `zipvoice` or `zipvoice_distill`, which are models before and after distillation, respectively.
- If `<>` or `[]` appear in the text, strings enclosed by them will be treated as special tokens. `<>` denotes Chinese pinyin and `[]` denotes other special tags.

#### 1.2 Inference of a list of sentences
Translation:
- `--model-name` mo≈ºe byƒá `zipvoice` lub `zipvoice_distill`, kt√≥re oznaczajƒÖ modele przed i po destylacji, odpowiednio.
- Je≈õli w tek≈õcie pojawiƒÖ siƒô `<>` lub `[]`, ciƒÖgi znak√≥w otoczone nimi bƒôdƒÖ traktowane jako specjalne tokeny. `<>` oznacza chi≈ÑskƒÖ transkrypcjƒô pinyin, a `[]` oznacza inne specjalne tagi.

#### 1.2 Wnioskowanie listy zda≈Ñ

RowTranslations.originContent: - `--model-name` can be `zipvoice` or `zipvoice_distill`, which are models before and after distillation, respectively.
RowTranslations.translatedContent: - `--model-name` mo≈ºe byƒá `zipvoice` lub `zipvoice_distill`, kt√≥re oznaczajƒÖ modele przed i po destylacji, odpowiednio.

RowTranslations.originContent: - If `<>` or `[]` appear in the text, strings enclosed by them will be treated as special tokens. `<>` denotes Chinese pinyin and `[]` denotes other special tags.

RowTranslations.originContent: #### 1.2 Inference of a list of sentences

Content:
```bash
python3 -m zipvoice.bin.infer_zipvoice \
    --model-name zipvoice \
    --test-list test.tsv \
    --res-dir results
```
Translation:
```bash
python3 -m zipvoice.bin.infer_zipvoice \
    --model-name zipvoice \
    --test-list test.tsv \
    --res-dir results
```

Content:
- Each line of `test.tsv` is in the format of `{wav_name}\t{prompt_transcription}\t{prompt_wav}\t{text}`.

### 2. Dialogue speech generation

#### 2.1 Inference command

To generate two-party spoken dialogues with our pre-trained ZipVoice-Dialogue or ZipVoice-Dialogue-Stereo models, use the following commands (Required models will be downloaded from HuggingFace):
Translation:
- Ka≈ºda linia pliku `test.tsv` ma format `{wav_name}\t{prompt_transcription}\t{prompt_wav}\t{text}`.

### 2. Generowanie mowy dialogowej

#### 2.1 Polecenie inferencji

Aby wygenerowaƒá dwuosobowe dialogi m√≥wione za pomocƒÖ naszych wytrenowanych modeli ZipVoice-Dialogue lub ZipVoice-Dialogue-Stereo, u≈ºyj nastƒôpujƒÖcych polece≈Ñ (Wymagane modele zostanƒÖ pobrane z HuggingFace):

Content:
```bash
python3 -m zipvoice.bin.infer_zipvoice_dialog \
    --model-name "zipvoice_dialog" \
    --test-list test.tsv \
    --res-dir results
```
Translation:
```bash
python3 -m zipvoice.bin.infer_zipvoice_dialog \
    --model-name "zipvoice_dialog" \
    --test-list test.tsv \
    --res-dir results
```

Content:
- `--model-name` can be `zipvoice_dialog` or `zipvoice_dialog_stereo`,
    which generate mono and stereo dialogues, respectively.

#### 2.2 Input formats

Each line of `test.tsv` is in one of the following formats:

(1) **Merged prompt format** where the audios and transcriptions of two speakers prompts are merged into one prompt wav file:
Translation:
- `--model-name` mo≈ºe przyjmowaƒá warto≈õci `zipvoice_dialog` lub `zipvoice_dialog_stereo`,
    kt√≥re generujƒÖ odpowiednio dialogi mono i stereo.

#### 2.2 Format wej≈õciowy

Ka≈ºda linia w pliku `test.tsv` ma jeden z poni≈ºszych format√≥w:

(1) **Format scalonej podpowiedzi**, gdzie nagrania audio i transkrypcje dw√≥ch m√≥wc√≥w sƒÖ scalone w jeden plik wav z podpowiedziƒÖ:

Content:
- `wav_name` is the name of the output wav file.
- `prompt_transcription` is the transcription of the conversational prompt wav, e.g, "[S1] Hello. [S2] How are you?"
- `prompt_wav` is the path to the prompt wav.
- `text` is the text to be synthesized, e.g. "[S1] I'm fine. [S2] What's your name? [S1] I'm Eric. [S2] Hi Eric."

(2) **Splitted prompt format** where the audios and transciptions of two speakers exist in separate files:
Translation:
- `wav_name` to nazwa wyj≈õciowego pliku wav.
- `prompt_transcription` to transkrypcja konwersacyjnego pliku wav, np. "[S1] Cze≈õƒá. [S2] Jak siƒô masz?"
- `prompt_wav` to ≈õcie≈ºka do pliku wav z promptem.
- `text` to tekst do syntezy, np. "[S1] Wszystko w porzƒÖdku. [S2] Jak masz na imiƒô? [S1] Jestem Eric. [S2] Cze≈õƒá Eric."

(2) **Format podzielonego promptu**, gdzie nagrania i transkrypcje dw√≥ch rozm√≥wc√≥w znajdujƒÖ siƒô w osobnych plikach:

RowTranslations.originContent: - `wav_name` is the name of the output wav file.
- `prompt_transcription` is the transcription of the conversational prompt wav, e.g, "[S1] Hello. [S2] How are you?"
RowTranslations.translatedContent: - `prompt_transcription` to transkrypcja konwersacyjnego pliku wav, np. "[S1] Cze≈õƒá. [S2] Jak siƒô masz?"

RowTranslations.originContent: - `prompt_wav` is the path to the prompt wav.
RowTranslations.translatedContent: - `prompt_wav` to ≈õcie≈ºka do pliku wav z promptem.

RowTranslations.originContent: - `text` is the text to be synthesized, e.g. "[S1] I'm fine. [S2] What's your name? [S1] I'm Eric. [S2] Hi Eric."
RowTranslations.translatedContent: - `text` to tekst do syntezy, np. "[S1] Wszystko w porzƒÖdku. [S2] Jak masz na imiƒô? [S1] Jestem Eric. [S2] Cze≈õƒá Eric."

RowTranslations.originContent: (2) **Splitted prompt format** where the audios and transciptions of two speakers exist in separate files:
RowTranslations.translatedContent: (2) **Format podzielonego promptu**, gdzie nagrania i transkrypcje dw√≥ch rozm√≥wc√≥w znajdujƒÖ siƒô w osobnych plikach:

Content:
- `wav_name` is the name of the output wav file.
- `spk1_prompt_transcription` is the transcription of the first speaker's prompt wav, e.g, "Hello"
- `spk2_prompt_transcription` is the transcription of the second speaker's prompt wav, e.g, "How are you?"
- `spk1_prompt_wav` is the path to the first speaker's prompt wav file.
- `spk2_prompt_wav` is the path to the second speaker's prompt wav file.
- `text` is the text to be synthesized, e.g. "[S1] I'm fine. [S2] What's your name? [S1] I'm Eric. [S2] Hi Eric."

### 3 Guidance for better usage:

#### 3.1 Prompt length

We recommand a short prompt wav file (e.g., less than 3 seconds for single-speaker speech generation, less than 10 seconds for dialogue speech generation) for faster inference speed. A very long prompt will slow down the inference and degenerate the speech quality.

#### 3.2 Speed optimization

If the inference speed is unsatisfactory, you can speed it up as follows:

- **Distill model and less steps**: For the single-speaker speech generation model, we use the `zipvoice` model by default for better speech quality. If faster speed is a priority, you can switch to the `zipvoice_distill` and can reduce the `--num-steps` to as low as `4` (8 by default).

- **CPU speedup with multi-threading**: When running on CPU, you can pass the `--num-thread` parameter (e.g., `--num-thread 4`) to increase the number of threads for faster speed. We use 1 thread by default.

- **CPU speedup with ONNX**: When running on CPU, you can use ONNX models with `zipvoice.bin.infer_zipvoice_onnx` for faster speed (haven't supported ONNX for dialogue generation models yet). For even faster speed, you can further set `--onnx-int8 True` to use an INT8-quantized ONNX model. Note that the quantized model will result in a certain degree of speech quality degradation. **Don't use ONNX on GPU**, as it is slower than PyTorch on GPU.

#### 3.3 Memory control

The given text will be splitted into chunks based on punctuation (for single-speaker speech generation) or speaker-turn symbol (for dialogue speech generation). Then, the chunked texts will be processed in batches. Therefore, the model can process arbitrarily long text with almost constant memory usage. You can control memory usage by adjusting the `--max-duration` parameter.

#### 3.4 "Raw" evaluation

By default, we preprocess inputs (prompt wav, prompt transcription, and text) for efficient inference and better performance. If you want to evaluate the model‚Äôs "raw" performance using exact provided inputs (e.g., to reproduce the results in our paper), you can pass `--raw-evaluation True`.

#### 3.5 Short text

When generating speech for very short texts (e.g., one or two words), the generated speech may sometimes omit certain pronunciations. To resolve this issue, you can pass `--speed 0.3` (where 0.3 is a tunable value) to extend the duration of the generated speech.

#### 3.6 Correcting mispronounced chinese polyphone characters

We use [pypinyin](https://github.com/mozillazg/python-pinyin) to convert Chinese characters to pinyin. However, it can occasionally mispronounce **polyphone characters** (Â§öÈü≥Â≠ó).
Translation:
- `wav_name` to nazwa wyj≈õciowego pliku wav.
- `spk1_prompt_transcription` to transkrypcja pliku wav z podpowiedziƒÖ pierwszego m√≥wcy, np. "Hello"
- `spk2_prompt_transcription` to transkrypcja pliku wav z podpowiedziƒÖ drugiego m√≥wcy, np. "How are you?"
- `spk1_prompt_wav` to ≈õcie≈ºka do pliku wav z podpowiedziƒÖ pierwszego m√≥wcy.
- `spk2_prompt_wav` to ≈õcie≈ºka do pliku wav z podpowiedziƒÖ drugiego m√≥wcy.
- `text` to tekst do syntezy, np. "[S1] I'm fine. [S2] What's your name? [S1] I'm Eric. [S2] Hi Eric."

### 3 Wskaz√≥wki dla lepszego u≈ºytkowania:

#### 3.1 D≈Çugo≈õƒá podpowiedzi

Zalecamy kr√≥tkie pliki wav z podpowiedziƒÖ (np. kr√≥tsze ni≈º 3 sekundy dla generowania mowy jednego m√≥wcy, kr√≥tsze ni≈º 10 sekund dla generowania mowy w dialogu) dla szybszego dzia≈Çania. Bardzo d≈Çugi plik z podpowiedziƒÖ spowolni dzia≈Çanie i pogorszy jako≈õƒá mowy.

#### 3.2 Optymalizacja szybko≈õci

Je≈õli szybko≈õƒá dzia≈Çania jest niezadowalajƒÖca, mo≈ºna jƒÖ zwiƒôkszyƒá nastƒôpujƒÖco:

- **Model destylowany i mniej krok√≥w**: Dla modelu generowania mowy jednego m√≥wcy domy≈õlnie u≈ºywamy modelu `zipvoice` dla lepszej jako≈õci mowy. Je≈õli priorytetem jest szybko≈õƒá, mo≈ºna prze≈ÇƒÖczyƒá na `zipvoice_distill` i zmniejszyƒá `--num-steps` nawet do `4` (domy≈õlnie 8).

- **Przyspieszenie CPU wielowƒÖtkowo≈õciƒÖ**: Przy uruchamianiu na CPU mo≈ºna podaƒá parametr `--num-thread` (np. `--num-thread 4`) aby zwiƒôkszyƒá liczbƒô wƒÖtk√≥w dla szybszej pracy. Domy≈õlnie u≈ºywamy 1 wƒÖtku.

- **Przyspieszenie CPU z ONNX**: Przy uruchamianiu na CPU mo≈ºna u≈ºyƒá modeli ONNX z `zipvoice.bin.infer_zipvoice_onnx` dla szybszego dzia≈Çania (nieobs≈Çugiwane jeszcze dla modeli generowania dialog√≥w). Aby uzyskaƒá jeszcze wiƒôkszƒÖ szybko≈õƒá, mo≈ºna ustawiƒá `--onnx-int8 True` aby u≈ºyƒá modelu ONNX z kwantyzacjƒÖ INT8. Nale≈ºy pamiƒôtaƒá, ≈ºe model kwantyzowany bƒôdzie mia≈Ç pewien spadek jako≈õci mowy. **Nie u≈ºywaj ONNX na GPU**, poniewa≈º jest wolniejszy ni≈º PyTorch na GPU.

#### 3.3 Kontrola pamiƒôci

Podany tekst zostanie podzielony na fragmenty na podstawie znak√≥w interpunkcyjnych (dla generowania mowy jednego m√≥wcy) lub symbolu zmiany m√≥wcy (dla generowania mowy w dialogu). Nastƒôpnie podzielone teksty bƒôdƒÖ przetwarzane w partiach. Dziƒôki temu model mo≈ºe przetwarzaƒá dowolnie d≈Çugi tekst przy niemal sta≈Çym zu≈ºyciu pamiƒôci. Mo≈ºesz kontrolowaƒá zu≈ºycie pamiƒôci, regulujƒÖc parametr `--max-duration`.

#### 3.4 Ocena "Raw"

Domy≈õlnie wstƒôpnie przetwarzamy wej≈õcia (plik wav z podpowiedziƒÖ, transkrypcjƒô podpowiedzi oraz tekst) dla efektywnego dzia≈Çania i lepszych wynik√≥w. Je≈õli chcesz oceniƒá "surowe" dzia≈Çanie modelu na dok≈Çadnie podanych wej≈õciach (np. aby odtworzyƒá wyniki z naszego artyku≈Çu), mo≈ºesz podaƒá `--raw-evaluation True`.

#### 3.5 Kr√≥tki tekst

Podczas generowania mowy dla bardzo kr√≥tkich tekst√≥w (np. jedno lub dwa s≈Çowa), wygenerowana mowa mo≈ºe czasem pomijaƒá pewne wymowy. Aby rozwiƒÖzaƒá ten problem, mo≈ºna podaƒá `--speed 0.3` (gdzie 0.3 to warto≈õƒá do regulacji), aby wyd≈Çu≈ºyƒá czas trwania wygenerowanej mowy.

#### 3.6 Poprawianie b≈Çƒôdnie wymawianych chi≈Ñskich znak√≥w wieloznacznych

U≈ºywamy [pypinyin](https://github.com/mozillazg/python-pinyin) do konwersji chi≈Ñskich znak√≥w na pinyin. Jednak czasami mo≈ºe b≈Çƒôdnie wymawiaƒá **znaki wieloznaczne** (Â§öÈü≥Â≠ó).

RowTranslations.translatedContent: Zalecamy kr√≥tkie pliki wav z podpowiedziƒÖ (np. kr√≥tsze ni≈º 3 sekundy dla generowania mowy jednego m√≥wcy, kr√≥tsze ni≈º 10 sekund dla generowania mowy w dialogu) dla szybszego dzia≈Çania. Bardzo d≈Çugi plik z podpowiedziƒÖ spowolni dzia≈Çanie i pogorszy jako≈õƒá mowy.

RowTranslations.originContent: We recommand a short prompt wav file (e.g., less than 3 seconds for single-speaker speech generation, less than 10 seconds for dialogue speech generation) for faster inference speed. A very long prompt will slow down the inference and degenerate the speech quality.

RowTranslations.translatedContent: Je≈õli szybko≈õƒá dzia≈Çania jest niezadowalajƒÖca, mo≈ºna jƒÖ zwiƒôkszyƒá nastƒôpujƒÖco:

RowTranslations.originContent: If the inference speed is unsatisfactory, you can speed it up as follows:

RowTranslations.translatedContent: - **Model destylowany i mniej krok√≥w**: Dla modelu generowania mowy jednego m√≥wcy domy≈õlnie u≈ºywamy modelu `zipvoice` dla lepszej jako≈õci mowy. Je≈õli priorytetem jest szybko≈õƒá, mo≈ºna prze≈ÇƒÖczyƒá na `zipvoice_distill` i zmniejszyƒá `--num-steps` nawet do `4` (domy≈õlnie 8).

RowTranslations.originContent: - **Distill model and less steps**: For the single-speaker speech generation model, we use the `zipvoice` model by default for better speech quality. If faster speed is a priority, you can switch to the `zipvoice_distill` and can reduce the `--num-steps` to as low as `4` (8 by default).

RowTranslations.translatedContent: - **Przyspieszenie CPU wielowƒÖtkowo≈õciƒÖ**: Przy uruchamianiu na CPU mo≈ºna podaƒá parametr `--num-thread` (np. `--num-thread 4`) aby zwiƒôkszyƒá liczbƒô wƒÖtk√≥w dla szybszej pracy. Domy≈õlnie u≈ºywamy 1 wƒÖtku.

RowTranslations.originContent: - **CPU speedup with multi-threading**: When running on CPU, you can pass the `--num-thread` parameter (e.g., `--num-thread 4`) to increase the number of threads for faster speed. We use 1 thread by default.

RowTranslations.translatedContent: - **Przyspieszenie CPU z ONNX**: Przy uruchamianiu na CPU mo≈ºna u≈ºyƒá modeli ONNX z `zipvoice.bin.infer_zipvoice_onnx` dla szybszego dzia≈Çania (nieobs≈Çugiwane jeszcze dla modeli generowania dialog√≥w). Aby uzyskaƒá jeszcze wiƒôkszƒÖ szybko≈õƒá, mo≈ºna ustawiƒá `--onnx-int8 True` aby u≈ºyƒá modelu ONNX z kwantyzacjƒÖ INT8. Nale≈ºy pamiƒôtaƒá, ≈ºe model kwantyzowany bƒôdzie mia≈Ç pewien spadek jako≈õci mowy. **Nie u≈ºywaj ONNX na GPU**, poniewa≈º jest wolniejszy ni≈º PyTorch na GPU.

RowTranslations.originContent: - **CPU speedup with ONNX**: When running on CPU, you can use ONNX models with `zipvoice.bin.infer_zipvoice_onnx` for faster speed (haven't supported ONNX for dialogue generation models yet). For even faster speed, you can further set `--onnx-int8 True` to use an INT8-quantized ONNX model. Note that the quantized model will result in a certain degree of speech quality degradation. **Don't use ONNX on GPU**, as it is slower than PyTorch on GPU.

RowTranslations.translatedContent: Podany tekst zostanie podzielony na fragmenty na podstawie znak√≥w interpunkcyjnych (dla generowania mowy jednego m√≥wcy) lub symbolu zmiany m√≥wcy (dla generowania mowy w dialogu). Nastƒôpnie podzielone teksty bƒôdƒÖ przetwarzane w partiach. Dziƒôki temu model mo≈ºe przetwarzaƒá dowolnie d≈Çugi tekst przy niemal sta≈Çym zu≈ºyciu pamiƒôci. Mo≈ºesz kontrolowaƒá zu≈ºycie pamiƒôci, regulujƒÖc parametr `--max-duration`.

RowTranslations.originContent: The given text will be splitted into chunks based on punctuation (for single-speaker speech generation) or speaker-turn symbol (for dialogue speech generation). Then, the chunked texts will be processed in batches. Therefore, the model can process arbitrarily long text with almost constant memory usage. You can control memory usage by adjusting the `--max-duration` parameter.

Je≈õli chcesz oceniƒá "surowe" dzia≈Çanie modelu na dok≈Çadnie podanych wej≈õciach (np. aby odtworzyƒá wyniki z naszego artyku≈Çu), mo≈ºesz podaƒá `--raw-evaluation True`.

If you want to evaluate the model‚Äôs "raw" performance using exact provided inputs (e.g., to reproduce the results in our paper), you can pass `--raw-evaluation True`.

Aby rozwiƒÖzaƒá ten problem, mo≈ºna podaƒá `--speed 0.3` (gdzie 0.3 to warto≈õƒá do regulacji), aby wyd≈Çu≈ºyƒá czas trwania wygenerowanej mowy.

RowTranslations.translatedContent: #### 3.6 Poprawianie b≈Çƒôdnie wymawianych chi≈Ñskich znak√≥w wieloznacznych
U≈ºywamy [pypinyin](https://github.com/mozillazg/python-pinyin) do konwersji chi≈Ñskich znak√≥w na pinyin. Jednak czasami mo≈ºe b≈Çƒôdnie wymawiaƒá **znaki wieloznaczne** (Â§öÈü≥Â≠ó).

RowTranslations.originContent: We use [pypinyin](https://github.com/mozillazg/python-pinyin) to convert Chinese characters to pinyin. However, it can occasionally mispronounce **polyphone characters** (Â§öÈü≥Â≠ó).

Content:
To manually correct these mispronunciations, enclose the **corrected pinyin** in angle brackets `< >` and include the **tone mark**.

**Example:**

- Original text: `ËøôÊääÂâëÈïø‰∏âÂçÅÂÖ¨ÂàÜ`
- Correct the pinyin of `Èïø`:  `ËøôÊääÂâë<chang2>‰∏âÂçÅÂÖ¨ÂàÜ`

> **Note:** If you want to manually assign multiple pinyins, enclose each pinyin with `<>`, e.g., `ËøôÊää<jian4><chang2><san1>ÂçÅÂÖ¨ÂàÜ`

#### 3.7 Remove long silences from the generated speech

Model will automatically determine the positions and lengths of silences in the generated speech. It occasionally has long silence in the middle of the speech. If you don't want this, you can pass `--remove-long-sil` to remove long silences in the middle of the generated speech (edge silences will be removed by default).

#### 3.8 Model downloading

If you have trouble connecting to HuggingFace when downloading the pre-trained models, try switching endpoint to the mirror site: `export HF_ENDPOINT=https://hf-mirror.com`.

## Train Your Own Model

See the [egs](egs) directory for training, fine-tuning and evaluation examples.

## C++ Deployment

Check [sherpa-onnx](https://github.com/k2-fsa/sherpa-onnx/pull/2487#issuecomment-3227884498) for the C++ deployment solution on CPU.

## Discussion & Communication

You can directly discuss on [Github Issues](https://github.com/k2-fsa/ZipVoice/issues).

You can also scan the QR code to join our wechat group or follow our wechat official account.

**Przyk≈Çad:**
